intro: Weigela rosea, commonly known as the roseleaf weigela, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. Its flowering period typically occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Weigela rosea is relatively low maintenance and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
